taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species huttonii;

treatment.other_name: (named in 1947 for its discoverer, eugene e. hutton, jr.)
treatment.description: Differing from no. 68 in the copiously stipitate-glandular slender canes; primocane-leaves coriaceous but opaque, subpersistent, 3-foliolate; the leaflets abruptly short-acuminate, glabrous except on nerves beneath, sharply serrate; terminal leaflet of 3-foliolate bracts elliptic-ovate, acute, the simple upper bracts nearly overtopping the corymb.
